basics.description: **Note:** Please refer to the following before installing the solution: • Review the solution [Release Notes](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Solutions/Cisco%20Secure%20Endpoint/ReleaseNotes.md) • There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing. The [Cisco Secure Endpoint](https://www.cisco.com/site/us/en/products/security/endpoint-security/secure-endpoint/index.html) (formerly AMP for Endpoints) data connector provides the capability to ingest Cisco Secure Endpoint [audit logs](https://api-docs.amp.cisco.com/api_resources/AuditLog?api_host=api.amp.cisco.com&api_version=v1) and [events](https://api-docs.amp.cisco.com/api_actions/details?api_action=GET+%2Fv1%2Fevents&api_host=api.amp.cisco.com&api_resource=Event&api_version=v1) into Microsoft Sentinel. **Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:** This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in [Preview](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/) state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs: a. [Azure Monitor HTTP Data Collector API](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/data-collector-api) b. [Azure Functions](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/functions/#overview) **Data Connectors:** 1, **Parsers:** 1, **Workbooks:** 1, **Analytic Rules:** 11, **Hunting Queries:** 10 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

metadata.hidden: Hiding location, we get it from the log analytics workspace

basics.name: getLAWorkspace
basics.toolTip: This filters by workspaces that exist in the Resource Group selected

basics.name: workspace
basics.label: Workspace
basics.toolTip: This dropdown will list only workspace that exists in the Resource Group selected

options.text: This Solution installs the data connector for Cisco Secure Endpoint. You can get Cisco Secure Endpoint custom log data in your Microsoft Sentinel workspace. After installing the solution, configure and enable this data connector by following guidance in Manage solution view.

The Solution installs a parser that transforms the ingested data into Microsoft Sentinel normalized format. The normalized format enables better correlation of different types of data from different data sources to drive end-to-end outcomes seamlessly in security monitoring, hunting, incident investigation and response scenarios in Microsoft Sentinel.

link.label: Learn more about connecting data sources

options.text: This solution installs workbook(s) to help you gain insights into the telemetry collected in Microsoft Sentinel. After installing the solution, start using the workbook in Manage solution view.
Sets the time name for analysis
This solution installs the following analytic rule templates. After installing the solution, create and enable analytic rules in Manage solution view.

elements.name: analytic1
elements.label: Cisco SE High Events Last Hour

options.text: Find events from Cisco Secure Endpoint that are of High severity in the last hour.

elements.name: analytic2
elements.label: Cisco SE - Connection to known C2 server

options.text: This rule is triggered when connection to known C2 is detected from host.

elements.name: analytic3
elements.label: Cisco SE - Dropper activity on host

options.text: Detects possible dropper activity on host.
This rule is triggered when generic IOC is observed on host.

elements.name: analytic5
elements.label: Cisco SE - Malware execusion on host

options.text: Detects malware execution on host.
Detects possible malware outbreak.

elements.name: analytic7
elements.label: Cisco SE - Multiple malware on host

options.text: This rule triggers when multiple malware where detected on host.
Detects policy updates failures.
This rule is triggered when possible ransomware activity is detected on host.
Detects binary files in uncommon locations.
Detects possible webshell on host.
This solution installs the following hunting queries. After installing the solution, run these hunting queries to hunt for threats in Manage solution view.
Query searches for infected hosts. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
Query searches for infected users. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
Query searches for user logins to management console. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
Query searches for malicious files. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery5
elements.label: Cisco SE - Modified agents on hosts

options.text: Query searches for hosts with modified agent settings. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
Query searches for rare scanned files. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
Query searches for scanned files. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
Query searches for suspicious powershell downloads. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
Query searches for uncommon application behavior events. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
Query searches for vulnerable applications on hosts. This hunting query depends on CiscoSecureEndpoint data connector (CiscoSecureEndpoint Parser or Table)
